answer: The significance of the interlayer Berry connection polarizability is that it plays a crucial role in the unique effect of rectification and transport probe in chiral bilayers. It allows for the development of a dc Hall current that can be controlled by the phase difference of two driving fields, leading to tunability in the on/off state, direction, and magnitude of the current. This effect is a characteristic feature of chiral bilayers and can be observed in materials such as small angle twisted transition metal dichalcogenides (tTMDs) and twisted bilayer graphene (tBG).
